resources.string: Machu Picchu is an ancient Incan citadel located in the Andes Mountains of Peru. It is believed to have been built in the 15th century and was later abandoned. The site includes intricate stone structures, terraced gardens, and plazas that were built without the use of mortar. It is considered one of the most significant examples of Incan architecture and engineering and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Machu Picchu is also known for its beautiful setting, nestled high in the mountains and surrounded by lush vegetation. It is a popular tourist destination and can be reached by hiking the Inca Trail or taking a train from the nearby town of Aguas Calientes.

Tokyo is the capital and largest city of Japan. It is a bustling metropolis known for its high-tech advancements, unique blend of traditional and modern culture, and delicious food. The city is home to over 13 million people and is a major center for business, finance, and transportation. It also has many tourist attractions, such as the Tokyo Tower,the Imperial Palace, and the Sensoji Temple. Additionally, Tokyo is also famous for its shopping and entertainment districts, such as Shinjuku and Shibuya.
